elementary functions colon >>

and

logical 'AND' operator, &

Syntax

C = and(A, B)
C = A & B

Input argument

A

a variable

B

a variable

Output argument

C

result of A & B

Description

C = and(A, B) performs a logical AND operations.

Example

A = [6 8 0; 0 3 89; 15 0 0]
B = [66 56 0; 11 33 55; -11 0 0]
C = A & B
D = and(B, A)
C == D

See also

or, xor, all, any, not.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
